Judul: Integrated Reservoir Characterization of the Paleocene Farewell Formation, Taranaki Basin, New Zealand, Using Petrophysical And Petrographical Analyses
Abstrak:
A reservoir characterization study, using petrophysical and petrographic analyses, has been made on the Paleocene Farewell
Formation in the Taranaki Basin, New Zealand, based on fve selected wells. Farewell Formation is largely a sandstone formation belonging to the Kapuni Group. The integrated study has shown that Farewell Formation is a good promising reservoir
with average efective porosity of 17.7% and permeability of 415 mD. The petrographic study indicates the occurrence of
abundant intergranular and secondary pores. It also proved that the Farewell Formation has been afected by several diagenetic
features. Compaction, cementation and clay mineral authigenesis are the most common. Quartz and feldspar overgrowths
have been recorded in many samples, and secondary porosity due to dissolution is also observed. In general, good reservoir
quality features are dominant in the Farewell Formation and diagenesis has little efect on the reservoir quality. These fndings are supported by well log interpretation results, which confrm good sand and net pay zones are available with very
low average water saturation (24.9%).
Kata Kunci: Petrography; Well log; Petrophysical; Farewell formation; Reservoir quality
Sumber: Journal of Petroleum Exploration and Production Technology, Volume 8, Issue 3, 685-701 (September 2018), https://doi.org/10.1007/s13202-018-0420-5
